We can think of $\purpleC{12}$ as $\purpleC{1\text{ ten}}$ and $\purpleC{2 \text{ ones}}$.  

We can think of $\blueD{84}$ as $\blueD{8\text{ tens}}$ and $\blueD{4\text{ ones}}$.

$\phantom{=}\purpleC{12}+\blueD{84}$

$=\purpleC{1\text{ ten}}+\purpleC{2\text{ ones}}+\blueD{8\text{ tens}}+\blueD{4\text{ ones}}$

$= \purpleC{1\text{ ten}}+\blueD{8\text{ tens}}+\purpleC{2\text{ ones}}+\blueD{4\text{ ones}}$
The answer: $1 \text{ ten}+8\text{ tens} +2 \text{ ones}+4 \text{ ones}$
